segment.source: To successfully deploy Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM), you must first determine the Group Policies that you will use in your implementation of Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.
segment.target: To successfully deploy Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM), you must first determine the Group Policies that you will use in your implementation of Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring.

segment.source: For more information about the various available policies, see Planning for MBAM 1.0 Group Policy Requirements.
segment.target: For more information about the various available policies, see Planning for MBAM 1.0 Group Policy Requirements.

segment.source: After you have determined the policies that you are going to use, you then must modify one or more Group Policy Objects (GPO) that include the MBAM policy settings.
segment.target: After you have determined the policies that you are going to use, you then must modify one or more Group Policy Objects (GPO) that include the MBAM policy settings.

segment.source: The following steps describe how to configure the basic, recommended Group Policy object (GPO) settings to enable MBAM to manage BitLocker encryption for your organization’s client computers.
segment.target: The following steps describe how to configure the basic, recommended Group Policy object (GPO) settings to enable MBAM to manage BitLocker encryption for your organization’s client computers.

segment.source: To edit the MBAM Client GPO settings
segment.target: To edit the MBAM Client GPO settings

segment.source: On a computer that has MBAM Group Policy template installed, make sure that MBAM services are enabled.
segment.target: On a computer that has MBAM Group Policy template installed, make sure that MBAM services are enabled.

segment.source: Use the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC.msc) or the Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) MDOP product for these actions: Select Computer configuration, choose Policies, click Administrative Templates, select Windows Components, and then click MDOP MBAM (BitLocker Management).
segment.target: Use the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC.msc) or the Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) MDOP product for these actions: Select Computer configuration, choose Policies, click Administrative Templates, select Windows Components, and then click MDOP MBAM (BitLocker Management).

segment.source: Edit the Group Policy Object settings that are required to enable MBAM Client services on client computers.
segment.target: Edit the Group Policy Object settings that are required to enable MBAM Client services on client computers.

segment.source: For each policy in the table that follows, select Policy Group, click the Policy, and then configure the Setting.
